abstract: The drug company said it paid about $20 million to 4,500 doctors and other professionals for consulting and speaking on its behalf.
snippet: The drug company said it paid about $20 million to 4,500 doctors and other professionals for consulting and speaking on its behalf.
lead_paragraph: Pfizer, the world’s largest drug maker, said Wednesday that it paid about $20 million to 4,500 doctors and other medical professionals for consulting and speaking on its behalf in the last six months of 2009, its first public accounting of payments to the people who decide which drugs to recommend.

headline.main: Pfizer Gives Details on Payments to Doctors
headline.print_headline: Pfizer Gives Details on Payments to Doctors
